content: What British rock band, formed in London in 1970, included members Freddie Mercury, Brian May, Roger Taylor, and John Deacon?

Oh, that's a classic! The British rock band you're referring to is Queen. They were indeed formed in London in 1970, and their lineup consisted of Freddie Mercury on vocals, Brian May on guitar, Roger Taylor on drums, and John Deacon on bass. Queen is renowned for their innovative approach to rock music, blending various genres and creating some of the most iconic songs in history. Their music continues to inspire and entertain audiences around the world.
